file_content.text: We've won a major victory, but the war is just beginning. Your squad will be playing a vital role in our campaign against Rakton.
Havoc Squad is ready to serve, General.
We're always prepared.
Havoc Squad is going to win this war, General. No matter what.
The Imps don't stand a chance.
We're counting on it.
With a record like mine, you get used to the big ops.
I'm used to the spotlight.
Right now, we need every advantage we can get--every available force must be put to work to counter the Empire's moves.
Some of our top military units are bogged down on backwater planets instead of serving on the front lines where they belong.
Havoc Squad is going to get our top forces where they need to be, starting with a group of elite pilots trapped on Belsavis. Understood?
We'll do whatever it takes to get those men into the fight.
Understood.
That's why you're the best in the Republic.
Can you give me any intel on Belsavis, General?
Belsavis?
We'll discuss the details once you've arrived in orbit.
Don't send me to free up resources, send me to kill Rakton!
That's a waste of time.
As soon as we know his location, you'll be the first person I contact.
Our forces are still spread thin. Saving our allies has relieved some pressure, but to turn the tide, we need every advantage we can get.
We will not accept defeat at the hands of the Empire. We will defeat them--utterly and completely.
Yes, General!
Time to find out what medal they hand out for winning a war.
Sounds like fun.
I'm not stopping until every last Imp is facedown in the dirt. Time to get started.
That was always my plan.
Major! Stand at ease. It's good to see you again, welcome back!
You remember Supreme Commander Rans. We were reviewing the results of your mission--you did an excellent job on Outpost 256. Congratulations.
I'm just glad we could intervene.
Thank you.
Our allies are glad, too. I'll see that Helik receives a commendation of some kind.
Rakton was on the holo when I rescued the heads of state.
I spoke to General Rakton.
Good. Let him see what you're capable of--let him wonder when it will be his office that you're blasting your way through.
If our supposed allies had stood strong for once, I wouldn't have had to waste my time out there.
It should never have happened.
Securing the Republic's alliances and saving important heads of state is never a waste of time.
It's unfortunate that the Imperials executed Premier Vonn and Archduke Kailur. They were both very popular with their people.
We've... ensured their people will remember them as heroes who died defying the Empire. Their memory will set the example for their citizens.
As soon as they heard what happened on Outpost 256, our allies began full-scale strikes against the Imperials in their territories.
The plan worked just like we'd hoped. When word of the rescue got out, our allies began immediate strikes against the Empire's forces.
You have your assignment, Major.
Major. Stand at ease. Let's get straight to the situation at hand.
After we destroyed the Gauntlet, General Rakton called a "diplomatic summit" with the heads of state of several Republic-allied planets along our borders.
The summit was held aboard a neutral space station, where Rakton's troops seized the heads of state by force. They are now hostages of the Empire.
You want Havoc to get the heads of state out of there alive.
So this is a rescue op.
Correct. It's the only way to stop Rakton's plans.
How does this tie into Rakton's invasion plan?
Why take hostages?
This is Rakton's invasion plan.
I wouldn't have expected anyone to fall for peace talks with the Empire.
What a bunch of morons.
Public pressure to attend peace talks is quite high. This war has people understandably terrified.
With their leaders held hostage, our allies are allowing Imperial troops to pass through their systems and strike us where we're vulnerable.
Our forces are at their limit. The Imperials will overwhelm us unless we rescue these heads of state and block Rakton's invasion routes.
What's our intel on the hostages' location?
Let's make it happen.
Can we count on our allies to fight once their leaders are safe?
Will this rescue really help?
Once their leaders are back to guide them, I'm confident our allies will fight harder for our cause than ever before.
No hostages are worth allowing an invasion, no matter how important they are.
Our allies gave up too easily.
I agree, but this is the situation we are presented with. "Let them die" isn't the solution our allies want to hear.
The station where the heads of state are being held is called Outpost 256. Imperial security is tight, but we've developed an entry plan.
Helik, a diplomat for one of these worlds, is flying there to surrender his government's security codes. He's volunteered to sneak your team aboard.
How can we minimize the risk to the hostages when we storm the station?
What's the plan once aboard?
Lieutenant Yuun will be responsible for that portion of the plan.
It takes a lot of guts to fly into a hostage situation.
That's a brave diplomat.
Yes, he's taking a great risk for us. Let's make the most of it.
I don't like relying on a diplomat with no combat experience.
Sounds risky to me.
There are no other options. Time is critical, and Helik is an opportunity we can't afford to pass up.
Your ship will ride alongside Helik's, detaching at the last second and landing in an unused maintenance hangar aboard the station.
Lieutenant Yuun will slice into the station's security and stop any alarms from sounding while you storm the crew area and secure the hostages. Understood?
I'm ready to begin immediately, General.
Understood.
This one will be easy.
Fighting through the elite commandos that have seized the station should give you plenty of exercise.
Those fat bureaucrats will be back in their palaces in no time.
Let's get this over with.
These are valued allies of the Republic, Major. Try to show them some respect.
Helik will rendezvous with you at these coordinates. The Imperials are expecting him to deliver his security codes very soon, so move quickly.
Remember: The safety of the Republic depends entirely on the safety of these men. Good luck.
Major. This is General Garza. I need you to report to my office on Coruscant immediately.
General Rakton made his move--the Imperials have invaded dozens of Republic planets. Havoc Squad is needed--immediately.
Is there a plan for dealing with this invasion, General?
What's our counteroffensive?
Would've been nice to have a real break for once.
I was just starting to relax.
The real breaks come when this invasion ends.
I should be with our troops on the ground, not chatting in your office!
Send me to the fight!
Let the standard forces handle the standard fighting. Havoc has a more specific target.
I'll brief you on the details when you arrive. Move quickly. Garza out.
I know you've just completed another major operation, but our situation is critical.
